House Bill/Resolution NO. PS00016
FULL TITLE : NEED FOR THE PROPER IMPLEMENTATION OF THE "ANTI-DRUNK AND DRUGGED DRIVING LAW"
SHORT TITLE : Anti - Drunk Driving
ABSTRACT : Upon recognition by the Chair, Rep. Jose Antonio “Kuya Jonathan” R. Sy-Alvarado from the First District of Bulacan called for the proper implementation of Republic Act No. 10586 also known as the “AntiDrunk and Drugged Driving Act of 2013.” This, as he cited statistics and reports on road safety and road accidents due to drunk driving or driving under the influence of drugs and similar substances; mentioned recent newspaper reports on road safety and road rage; and informed his colleagues of a vehicular accident involving him and a policeman in Calumpit, Bulacan which required him to wear a neck brace for at least five months. As he called on the people to faithfully adhere to the road safety laws in order to save lives, he likewise seek stiffer penalties for those who will violate the law. As such, he asked that he be allowed to be a coauthor of House Bill No. 5, amending RA No. 10586 to impose higher penalties for violations thereof. With the reported increase in number of accidents related to alcohol intoxication and drugs, Rep. Sy-Alvarado earnestly appealed on the need for government to strengthen its advocacy on road safety to lessen the deaths attributed to drunk or drugged driving. (SOURCE: HOuse Journal No.5,p.49)
